title: Migraine Prevention and Management
content: Migraine management includes acute treatment and preventive therapy. Acute treatments include NSAIDs, triptans, and newer CGRP antagonists. Preventive therapy is considered for frequent or disabling migraines, with options including beta-blockers, anticonvulsants, antidepressants, and CGRP monoclonal antibodies. Lifestyle modifications addressing triggers, sleep hygiene, stress management, and regular exercise are integral components of comprehensive management.
